div.p: It's a free software tool to enable teachers and lecturers to create online learning resources and activities for students.
Oh, right. Sounds like one of those virtual learning environment things.
Yes, that's it. Online courses can contain quizzes, assignments, group activities like wikis, forums and so on. Learners can also keep a blog and use synchronous chat.
Sounds like it has lots of features.
Yes, it's great for collaboration and social activity, and it can be adapted to many teaching styles.
It was created by Martin Dougiamas in Australia, and is developed by him and a group of developers from around the world. Moodle is open source so anyone can contribute.
Interesting. Where can I try it?
